Last Week

Matthew Reinbold

  • Fri, Nov 19, 2021 - @timburks True. Despite the rise of New Power methods detailed in @jeffiel's Ask Your Developer, there are still quite a few Old Power gatekeepers. Reaching the communities that lie beyond them comes with a toll.
  • Fri, Nov 19, 2021 - @ptevis Great question. I think, in ideal situations, that could be a role played by the retrospective or postmortem; a moment to assess completed work's performance in the larger system to apply learnings to new work. However, I believe these too often end up in mechanical minutia

  • Fri, Nov 19, 2021 - "Simultaneously improving all areas of an API ecosystem can be difficult. Focusing limited time and energy on the areas of most significant impact is a better strategy, and API ecosystem maps can help identify those areas more efficiently and effectively." https://t.co/MIxssDD7qR
  • Fri, Nov 19, 2021 - #QOTD: "People are fairly good at short-term design, and usually awful at long-term design." - Dr. Roy Fielding

Last Month

Matthew Reinbold

  • Mon, Nov 08, 2021 - Reflecting on #softwareGovernance this morning: "Study an information system and neglect its standards, wires, and settings, and you miss equally essential aspects of aesthetics, justice, and change." - https://t.co/mHEmFou1Dy https://t.co/XgQOjlL48m
  • Mon, Nov 08, 2021 - "The people that feel they are API-First outperform their peers in these key, essential, business-value delivery drivers." Excited to sit down with Erik and discuss the @getpostman 2021 State of The API Report https://t.co/HLfrxvRzui
  • Fri, Nov 05, 2021 - "-the 2021 Postman State of the API Report proved a correlation between high-performing, API-First orgs and key behaviors....we can show that healthy API ecosystems ship APIs sooner, incorporate changes more often, recover faster after outages, and require fewer hotfixes." https://t.co/nlEgjShYgg
  • Thu, Nov 04, 2021 - In the 180th Net #API Notes, I deep dive on the 2021 State of the APIs Report; specifically, *what are the four behaviors of high-performing API teams*? And how do we measure them? https://t.co/NUgM08DSoJ https://t.co/VghWEIPMV3
  • Thu, Nov 04, 2021 - I feel like there could be an entire book on discovering stakeholders, understanding their success criteria, and weaving a narrative of all parties' needs. @kevinswiber does a great introduction. Remember to emphasize the 'why' we should do API-First over the 'what'. https://t.co/3Oz8tXhriP
  • Tue, Nov 02, 2021 - Why is there no one "correct" #API lifecycle? If a lifecycle is so important, why can't we agree on the steps? Some thoughts: https://t.co/v9w99iJQJe https://t.co/Z27NxoWOCg
  • Mon, Nov 01, 2021 - I've struggled to articulate diff between API *outputs* & *outcomes*. "An outcome rewrites the hero of the story to be the API customers instead of the API creator. The plot is no longer about how the API gets delivered, but how the customer succeeds with it." That resonate?
  • Mon, Nov 01, 2021 - Still reviewing lessons from @ruthmalan's organizational dynamics class the past several weeks. One initial "aha!" moment was the introduction of polarity maps, and how they can be used to pop the false centralized/decentralized #APIgovernance dichotomy: https://t.co/DFnyDHXbYe https://t.co/kQUWHGPelR
  • Fri, Oct 29, 2021 - The reason digital transformation efforts fail so often is that it is so much more than buying some software licenses or attending an offsite. Success requires understanding, dismantling, and rebuilding systems of power. Too many are poorly equipped for that work.
  • Thu, Oct 28, 2021 - With a record number of responses, the @getpostman's 2021 State of API Report is the largest looks at the API Economy to date. Check out the insights here: https://t.co/bpPmD0EhEH https://t.co/DuVIyDTwU5
  • Wed, Oct 27, 2021 - Net API Notes #179: * Omer Primor on Securing the #API Lifecycle * @dret and @programmingart on HTTP/3's API Impact * @launchany on getting Style Guides *used* That and more: https://t.co/svf9rFOn5G https://t.co/RKn6yzcLBM
  • Thu, Oct 21, 2021 - On #API_governance: "Throwing seeds on the ground and coming back months later expecting something to harvest isn't statistically likely. And micro-managing the interplay between the numerous participants in such a complex environment also doesn't scale." https://t.co/3NKkUdHK5r https://t.co/XUnhknnh60
